word_mean: 界标：一个容易识别的解剖学结构，在对另一结构定位或决定某些量度时用的一个参考点

entry.def: A landmark is a building or feature which is easily noticed and can be used to judge your position or the position of other buildings or features.

example.ex: The Ambassador Hotel is a Los Angeles landmark.
example.tran: 国宾大饭店是洛杉矶的地标性建筑之一。

entry.def: You can refer to an important stage in the development of something as a landmark .

example.tran: 里程碑式的军备控制条约

example.ex: The baby was one of the big landmarks in our relationship.
example.tran: 孩子的出世是我们俩关系中的一个重要转折点。

means.word_mean: 1. the position of a prominent or well-known object in a particular landscape;

sentences.sentence: "the church steeple provided a convenient landmark"

means.word_mean: 2. an event marking a unique or important historical change of course or one on which important developments depend;

sentences.sentence: "the agreement was a watershed in the history of both nations"

means.word_mean: 3. a mark showing the boundary of a piece of land
4. an anatomical structure used as a point of origin in locating other anatomical structures (as in surgery) or as point from which measurements can be taken

means.word_mean: 陆标，地标（有助于识别所处地点的大建筑物等）

sentences.en: The tower was once a landmark for ships.
sentences.cn: 这座塔曾是船只的陆标。

means.word_mean: （标志重要阶段的）里程碑 ~ (in sth)

sentences.en: The Russian Revolution represents a landmark in world history.
